Chapter 33.inflection: quis, quid [after: si, nisi, num, or ne]

meanings: to be born; spring forth arise
relating to a free person; worthy of a free man
to pour a libation on; pour ritually; sip; touch gently

Chapter 22.inflection: res publica, rei publicae (f) state,  commonwealth, republic

meanings: 1. introduces question anticipating a “no”. 2. introduces indirect questions and means “whether.”
to have good taste; have good sense
to lie; lie prostrate; lie dead
that; the former; the famous; (at times) he
hurry away; escape; go into exile; avoid
head; leader; beginning; life; heading; chapter
a letter of the alphabet; (plural = letter

Chapter 7.inflection: sub (+abl with verbs of rest, +acc with verbs of motion)

meanings: (interrogative pronoun) who? whose? whom? what? which?
situation. (in ablative + preceding genitive: for the sake of)
an enemy (of the state); (plural = the enemy)
lie open; be accessible; be evident
and (suffix added to the end a word
